definition: death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
(archaic) I/me/variant of 餘|余[yu2], surplus
crime/sin
surname Gu

sentences.english: In front of the interests of the party, they deserve to die.
sentences.chinese: 在党国利益面前，他们死有余辜。

sentences.english: They are traitors who have committed towering crimes and deserve more than death.
sentences.chinese: 他们是罪大恶极，死有余辜的叛徒。

definition: guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
guilty of terrible crimes (idiom)/reprehensible
lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
willfully slaughter the innocent (idiom)
wicked beyond redemption (idiom)/heinous
to have only oneself to blame (idiom)/to bring trouble through one's own actions
evil crimes fill heaven (idiom)
hoodlum/bad guy
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
to have disregard for human life (idiom)
devoid of conscience (idiom); utterly heartless
scum of a community/degenerate
to make mincemeat of sb/to hack sb to pieces (used while cursing)
worse than a beast/to behave immorally
